task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 23°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to look up to see the full height of the building from ground to roof, as the current pitch is 0° and I can't see the top.
I am currently looking up at 30°, but I still cannot see the full height of the building; I need to tilt further upward to capture the roofline.
I am still at 30° pitch and cannot see the full height of the building; I need to rotate further upward to capture the roofline for accurate height estimation.
I have been stuck at 30° pitch for multiple steps; I must adjust to a higher pitch (e.g., 60°) to see the full height of the building and estimate it accurately.

At 60° pitch, I can now see the top of the building; combining this with my known distance (~12.5–12.8m) and trigonometry (height = distance * tan(pitch)), I estimate the height to be approximately 22.0 meters.
